futures.name: Universal Impregnable Historical Register
futures.abstract: History has been consistently rewritten since the dawn of time. As more and more historical registers become digital, the ability to both rewrite and erase history has become increasingly easy. The power that was once limited to scholars and leaders is now in the hands of everyday hackers. A Universal Impregnable Historical Register would securely hold records (from land registries and birth records to scorekeeping and news articles), ensuring the first truly comprehensive representation of the past. Entries into the register could still be recorded with bias, but no one will have the power to edit data after the fact.

futures.name: VR Memory Playback
futures.abstract: Virtual Reality (VR) is an immersive audiovisual experience that simulates physical presence in spaces. If your entire life was recorded, you could travel back in time with VR and re-live your memories. Potential applications range from daily recollection to literally walking in someone else’s shoes. In an increasingly oversaturated world, VR Memory Playback would take the burden of memory allowing people to focus on the present.

futures.name: Genetic Identity Patent
futures.abstract: Genetically engineering a fetus while it is still in the womb produces what is known as a ‘designer baby’. Today, doppelgangers are constructed with plastic surgery, but in the future one could design their baby to take on the visage of their favorite pop star. To prevent the theft and potential proliferation of your genetic identity, invest in a patent to protect your unique look.

futures.name: Human Driver Ban
futures.abstract: Cars that drive themselves, using sensors to perceive and interpret the environment around them to navigate our existing roads, are being developed by companies like Google, Mercedes, BMW and Tesla. They will increase mobility for those who can’t drive themselves and have the potential to revolutionize infrastructure, regional travel, and vehicular accident rates. Every self-driving car accident to date has been caused by human error, either in an adjacent car or through manual override. Banning human drivers entirely would ensure that self-driving cars could operate safely and efficiently.

futures.name: Basic Universal Welfare/Income
futures.abstract: Basic universal income and welfare are unconditional forms of payment that cover an individual’s living and health care costs. This kind of system not only ensures a basic standard of living, it supports a flexible, freelance lifestyle. Uber contractors currently don’t have a support system if they are sick or  injured, basic universal income and welfare would create a safety net for the on-demand workforce. A global, universal system would provide these benefits without requiring tests or creating conditions.

futures.name: 10-hour Work Week
futures.abstract: As the workforce becomes more automated, the relationship between people and work will change. Labor will be increasingly augmented by machines, but also autonomous machines will have the potential to construct everything from small scale devices to large-scale infrastructure without human supervision. A 10-hour work week will allow people to spend their time doing activities for personal fulfillment. Workforce automation will unleash the latent potential of the human race.

futures.name: Global Net Neutrality
futures.abstract: Net Neutrality preserves the right to communicate freely online. It is the principle that the internet enables and protects free speech through both universal access and non-discriminating content production. Global Net Neutrality assumes that internet access will truly become world wide. Individual countries would not be able to regulate the internet, which would allow for universal open communication.
